joehung302 wrote:

> I stopped the crawl finally...and the IO is still busy! I waited for a
> few minutes and it remains the same.
>
> Once I shutdown heritrix. It all comes back to normal. No more busy IO.
>
> I've had -Xmx1500m on 1.0.4 before. It never gives me this kind of IO
> rates. In fact the most I got from 1.0.4 was around 10-20% IO.

Joe:

I took a look at i/o in a rabid crawl.  I see some of the phenomeon you 
describe (My machine is in no danger of swapping so the i/o phenonmeon 
in my case was not as acute as for you).  Even after pausing the crawl, 
there remains an i/o load.  Watching the bdb state directory, I see bdb 
continue to write logs -- lots of its 10Mb log files -- for quite a 
while after the pause.  Eventually, after quite a long time, all damps 
down to near zero reads and writes.

We'll take a look. Maybe there's a tuning we can do in here to make the 
i/o loading less onerous (It does take a long time for the i/o to quite 
down).

>
> Is there any one out there seeing heavy IO when running 1.4?
>
1.0.4 kept alot of the important data structures in memory (Because of 
this, the size of the crawl was bound by the amount of memory allocated 
to Heritrix). The  main change with 1.4.0 is that it now keeps these on 
disk.  I'd expect there to be a big difference in the i/o between versions.

Yours,
St.Ack
